docs.lead_paragraph: Gail Collins: David, your writing on health care has been incredibly thoughtful, so I'm going to take this opportunity to poke you a little. Then I'll shut up so you can talk.

headline.main: What's Wrong With a Single-Payer System?

docs.abstract: Why Congress needs to start over and get serious about health care costs.
docs.snippet: Why Congress needs to start over and get serious about health care costs.

byline.original: By DAVID BROOKS AND GAIL COLLINS

docs.lead_paragraph: It is common for someone campaigning for office to answer the question he prefers instead of the one he's actually asked. It's harder to do that when governing, though: constituencies want their questions answered before they sign on to an initiative, like a radical reconfiguring of health care. And yet, when President Obama tried to make the case for health care reform to small business this weekend, he acted as if he were a candidate.

headline.main: Obama Tries to Sell the Mandate by Not Mentioning It

docs.abstract: If President Obama hopes to win over small business owners to health-care reform, he must confront their fears directly.
docs.snippet: If President Obama hopes to win over small business owners to health-care reform, he must confront their fears directly.

docs.lead_paragraph: I notice from comments that a fair number of readers think that Medicare has had runaway costs. What you need to ask is, runaway compared to what?

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated The House Energy and Commerce Committee will resume work on major health care legislation on Wednesday, after House leaders and a faction of fiscally conservative Democrats who had stalled the bill apparently reached a compromise after days of fitful negotiations.
